newsitem.title: JORDAN: Amman shares steady, block transfer boosts volume.
newsitem.headline: Amman shares steady, block transfer boosts volume.

text.p: A block transfer of shares in Jordan Kuwait Bank worth over four million dinars ($5.6 million) propped up turnover on the Amman stock exchange on Saturday in a steady market, brokers said.
They said the transfer was believed to be an internal sale between board members of the bank, related to on-off plans for a merger with Bank of Jordan.
"It certainly wasn't foreign buying," said Ibrahim Odeh of Wataniyeh brokerage. "There's no buying from outside, unlike two weeks ago."
Jordan Kuwait Bank shares fell by the maximum daily limit of five percent to 3.04 dinars in 4.4 million dinars of trade.
But the official 60-share Amman Financial Market (AFM) index rose 0.03 percent to 159.52 points in turnover of 5.3 million dinars.
Blue-chip Housing Bank rose 0.07 dinars to 4.97 dinars in trade worth 100,000 dinars and Jordan Phosphate Mines closed unchanged on 4.00 dinars after turnover worth 66,000 dinars.
Overall 15 shares rose, 16 fell and another 13 traded but closed unchanged.
The private Pearl Index of the 45 best-performing shares in terms of turnover and financial performance shed 0.13 percent to 81.77 points, 1.94 percent down from the start of the year.
